column5: The mountains here are still covered in snow and the big run-off here in the Kootenays is late. So fishing has been slower than I expect but still some some good times on the river. Wanted to share a few pics of my last couple of trips. The Bull Trout action has been slow but the Cutthroat bite has been pretty great. Too bad they don't get bigger here because they put up a great fight. Enjoy!                      Even my sister got in on the action with her first Bull Trout. Put up a great fight. She just might get into this crazy sport!     Cheers!

Nice! That one in the fourth picture sure has his eye on you-- looks a tad p-o'd?   Great place to be out there - scenery is fantastic. Congrats to both of you on a great outing. Thanks for the report
Great report, fish and pics Jet Thanks for sharing your little piece of paradise with us Leechman
I see the topic of your post and i'm like ... "Arg should I click into it? should i? I'll just be so depressed after seeing all your big fish and amazing scenery"  great report as always man.
thos ebull trout have menacing look to them
Thanks guys. If anyone is ever up this way, drop me a line so we can wet a line!
Oooooooooh ahhhhhhhh....Me likey a lot!  Can't wait to join you out there
